strIntroduction: Cycle quiet back trails and explore beautiful temples in the stunning and friendly Cambodian countryside Embark on a 30km biking adventure of nature and temples Dig into lunch at a local restaurant, plus enjoy fruit, snacks and water throughout Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Kids sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Embark on a 30km biking adventure of nature and temples Embark on a 30km biking adventure of nature and temples Dig into lunch at a local restaurant, plus enjoy fruit, snacks and water throughout Dig into lunch at a local restaurant, plus enjoy fruit, snacks and water throughout Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Kids sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Kids sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved What We Love:   What We Love: Escape the crowds, the busy roads and the well-worn trail at Angkor. After a riverside cycle to visit the amazing Angkor Wat, we then leave the road and spend the rest of the day on charming, quiet trails through majestic structures. Get up close to Ta Prohm, The Elephant Terrace, and Bayon as well as some less visited temples along the way. Finish by returning on a red dirt road and small rural village trail back to town. With a commitment to unique, carefully created tours, this is the authentic biking adventure you've been looking for. Led by an informative and entertaining Cambodian guide, you'll bike on countryside tracks and past stunning temples – it's suitable for anyone who can ride a bike and has a taste for adventure.

Be cleansed with sacred water said to bring peace and happiness, amongst beautiful surrounds, to the sound of sacred chants Receive a traditional Buddhist blessing at Wat Athvea temple or at Arang Pagoda Your English-speaking guide will lead you through the process and explain the ritual's meaning This is a beautiful and traditional way to bless a newly wed couple or for anyone needing a bit of extra luck! Enjoy convenient hotel transfers to take you to the beautiful countryside Receive a traditional Buddhist blessing at Wat Athvea temple or at Arang Pagoda Receive a traditional Buddhist blessing at Wat Athvea temple or at Arang Pagoda Your English-speaking guide will lead you through the process and explain the ritual's meaning Your English-speaking guide will lead you through the process and explain the ritual's meaning This is a beautiful and traditional way to bless a newly wed couple or for anyone needing a bit of extra luck! This is a beautiful and traditional way to bless a newly wed couple or for anyone needing a bit of extra luck! Enjoy convenient hotel transfers to take you to the beautiful countryside Enjoy convenient hotel transfers to take you to the beautiful countryside What We Love:   What We Love: Water Blessings are a traditional Cambodian practice that date back to ancient times. You'll be driven to an ancient pagoda, nestled in the beautiful countryside outside Siem Reap where you'll have a choice of two rituals. The first is almost a taster: a blessing accompanied by a light sprinkling of water. The second is the real deal: you'll be completely covered in water blessed by the monks (don't worry, you'll get a sarong to change into for the experience), whilst the monks chant in unison. At the end of your blessing, you'll receive a special red tie that signifies the ritual that was performed. This is a unique experience for individuals but can also be a special way for newly weds to celebrate their union as it's said that the blessing brings peace and happiness.

Fly above the jungle on 10 ziplines on a real outdoor adventure Feel like a true Indian Jones as you cross hanging bridges and zip down a 50 meter descent Learn about the exotic flora and fauna of the beautiful Angkor Park Don't miss out on a chance to spot gibbons in their natural environment Fly above the jungle on 10 ziplines on a real outdoor adventure Feel like a true Indian Jones as you cross hanging bridges and zip down a 50 meter descent Learn about the exotic flora and fauna of the beautiful Angkor Park Don't miss out on a chance to spot gibbons in their natural environment What We Love:   What We Love: Located in the beautiful Angkor Park, Flight of the Gibbon in Siem Reap is the only zipline staged in a UNESCO World Heritage site. A thrilling and unforgettable adventure, it takes you on a flight through a real jungle and lets you experience nature and wildlife in a truly fun way! Never been zeeplining before? Not a problem. Flight of the Gibbon's Sky Rangers will not only guide you through every step, but also join in on the activity sharing their rich knowledge about the jungle along the way. As you are zip above the evergreen forest and take stunning photos from the air, don't forget to keep an eye out for the gibbons and a chance to see them in their natural environment.
strTitle: Flight Of The Gibbon Siem Reap

strIntroduction: Take a day off from temple sightseeing and discover Cambodian village life. Experience life as a local and help out around the village by supporting a local charity tourism project Join a local host family in a rural farming village and help out with daily tasks Support responsible tourism and a local communities charity (5% of the tour price goes directly to the charity) With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour for up to 5 - you can be sure that you'll get a personalized experience Enjoy a casual picnic lunch with your Khmer host family Transportation to and from the village is provided plus the insight of a local guide Join a local host family in a rural farming village and help out with daily tasks Join a local host family in a rural farming village and help out with daily tasks Support responsible tourism and a local communities charity (5% of the tour price goes directly to the charity) Support responsible tourism and a local communities charity (5% of the tour price goes directly to the charity) With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour for up to 5 - you can be sure that you'll get a personalized experience With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour for up to 5 - you can be sure that you'll get a personalized experience Enjoy a casual picnic lunch with your Khmer host family Enjoy a casual picnic lunch with your Khmer host family Transportation to and from the village is provided plus the insight of a local guide Transportation to and from the village is provided plus the insight of a local guide What We Love:   What We Love: When visiting a country as a tourist, it's often very easy to ignore the poverty of the beautiful country you're in. The Day in a Life program strives to bridge the gap between tourists and ‘Type 1' village families (those that struggle to meet daily needs, and often for food too). A local host family will welcome you into their home and lives for the day. They receive a small payment for this task and a larger contribution is made to a village fund, used for village projects like water filters and wells. Step into a villager's shoes and help out with daily tasks: plant or harvest rice, weave thatch for roofs, create wall panels, plant vegetables or trees, make 'prahoc' or rice wine. Every tour is different and tasks depend on the time of year, family needs and village goings-on.

Connect with the real Cambodia. Embark on an easy ride through the Siem Reap countryside, learn about village life and try some delicious snacks Follow back road routes and unsealed village roads to discover a very different side to Siem Reap, far from the tourist crowds Try some tasty local snacks and fruit along the way and clean water provided throughout Let your entertaining and informative English-speaking local guide look after you and show you the way Flat tracks and non-hilly roads but with some small dirt trails means this tour is ideal for intermediate riders (not suitable for beginners) Follow back road routes and unsealed village roads to discover a very different side to Siem Reap, far from the tourist crowds Follow back road routes and unsealed village roads to discover a very different side to Siem Reap, far from the tourist crowds Try some tasty local snacks and fruit along the way and clean water provided throughout Try some tasty local snacks and fruit along the way and clean water provided throughout Let your entertaining and informative English-speaking local guide look after you and show you the way Let your entertaining and informative English-speaking local guide look after you and show you the way Flat tracks and non-hilly roads but with some small dirt trails means this tour is ideal for intermediate riders (not suitable for beginners) Flat tracks and non-hilly roads but with some small dirt trails means this tour is ideal for intermediate riders (not suitable for beginners) What We Love:   What We Love: Leave the temples behind and connect with the real Cambodia. Start with a leisurely ride along the Siem Reap River, then leave the tarmac for the narrower dirt paths leading you deeper into the scenic countryside. You'll pedal through friendly villages, where children run along waving you hello. Glance about to see wine and sugar production, basket weaving, rice farming and all sorts of activity that maintains the countryside buzz. Feeling peckish? Make a stop for some unique Cambodian snacks and fruit before making tracks back to town for a midday return. Prepare for a morning of laughter as your highly entertaining guide shows you the way and imparts local knowledge.

Capture moss-covered temples, rice terrace landscapes and the wonderful faces of Cambodia whilst being respectful of local people, culture and customs. With a completely flexible itinerary, the team personalizes the tour to match the experiences you are looking for. Your guide, with extensive photography experience and a deep knowledge of the area, will help you find the ideal locations for capturing some amazing photographs. Together you'll find the best places, uncover hidden secrets and get access to places you'd have otherwise missed. This isn't about how to use your camera, it's about getting you to the right place at the right time!

Discover the key to the Angkor Kingdom's agricultural prosperity and enjoy a day of exercise as you ride the countryside and villages west of Siem Reap and paddle through a small floating community and the great Tonle Sap Lake Embark on a 25-30km biking adventure with a 1 hour kayaking excursion to the villages and lakes outside of Siem Reap Dig in to a local lunch, plus enjoy fruits, snacks and water provided throughout Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Kid-sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Support a local charity, committed to helping the community through Eco-tourism Embark on a 25-30km biking adventure with a 1 hour kayaking excursion to the villages and lakes outside of Siem Reap Embark on a 25-30km biking adventure with a 1 hour kayaking excursion to the villages and lakes outside of Siem Reap Dig in to a local lunch, plus enjoy fruits, snacks and water provided throughout Dig in to a local lunch, plus enjoy fruits, snacks and water provided throughout Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Kid-sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Kid-sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Support a local charity, committed to helping the community through Eco-tourism Support a local charity, committed to helping the community through Eco-tourism What We Love:   What We Love: Hop out of bed for an early morning ride along the great irrigation reservoirs of the Angkor period, the West Baray. By late morning you find yourself in a small village, where lives are supported by seasonal agriculture. Join a local resident for a walk ‘n' talk explaining the community workings then it's time for a tasty lunch and some hammock chill time. After lunch, you'll paddle through the floating villages by kayak. Explore the neighborhood and the mangrove forest before venturing onto Tonle Sap Lake where the sheer size of this body of water will become apparent. Your guide will explain the phenomenon that has resulted in the lake's eight-meter depth variance and why this lake is vital to Cambodia's survival. This is a tour for any adventurer who wants to explore beyond the tourist crowds of Siem Reap and support a company whose goal is to protect the local Cambodian community.

Tap into the local knowledge of your Khmer guide and make the most of his translator skills! What We Love:   What We Love: How best to see Cambodia? Like the locals of course! The Khmer people's main means of transport is motorbike, and it's the quickest way to escape the tourist traps and see the real Cambodia. You'll get a true sense of freedom zooming along the Khmer trails through green rice fields, lush bamboo groves and remote jungle. The roads are virtually traffic-free and the 125cc Honda Dreams are easy to ride. But just to be on the safe side, you'll get extensive instructions and the chance to scoot about and test your skills first. If you're not feeling confident, not to worry, just hop on the back of the guide's bike instead. Visit several low-key sites including the isolated Koh Khrong temple before heading over to an ancient reservoir for a delicious BBQ. Take a refreshing swim, go inner tubing, try your hand at fishing or relax in the surrounding nature whilst lunch is prepared. What's more, the community benefits directly from every visitor through a specially set up development fund.

Enjoy a two hour Walk and Talk introduction to a traditional Cambodian village, including a visit to the local pagoda, the HUSK Community School and workshop. You will get to visit a local village and learn all about the traditional stilt homes and the life around them. The tour includes a visit to the active Pagoda and the HUSK NGO English school. Taking about 2.5 hours and covering the distance of 2 kilometers, the tour is a great chance to explore quaint village life, interact with the locals and have your many questions answered. With beautiful country views, you will have lots of chances to capture the nature of Cambodia and its friendly locals. Your English speaking guide will give you all the missing pieces and you will return home with a traditional Khmer sun hat as a gift.

It's perfect for the majority of us who'll never make the arduous climb to the summit. The flight – aboard Buddha Air, Yeti Air or Simrik Air – covers the incredible mountain ranges, glaciers and gorges of the Himalayan region, so you can expect to spend an hour in awe over these striking sights. See the top Everest, the world's highest mountain, and spot as many as 16 neighboring peaks on your airborne adventure: Kangchenjunga, third in the world; Lhotse, following at fourth; Makalu, the Annapurnas, and many more.

What We Love:   What We Love: They say one of the best ways to know a culture is through its cuisine – so expect to enjoy a slice of authentic Nepali life in this authentic, local cooking class! Opt for a morning or afternoon session, and meet local host families for cookouts in time for lunch, or for dinner. You'll learn to whip up everyday home-cooked meals, featuring authentic local foodstuff like dhalbhat, a savory rice special served with lentils, curry meat or fish, and various spices; momos, the local version of Japanese gyozas; and sel roti, the sweet bread treat. You'll also pick up some Nepali phrases along the way, and get a taste for everyday living as you share your own cooking with the family!

Those with tighter itineraries will appreciate the swift transit of these one-way flights. Bringing both cities within easy access of the other, hopping aboard a plane is a great way to optimize your Nepal stay!

Paddle through the rapids of the famed Trisuli River in this thrilling adventure with public or private return transfer to Kathmandu, or, if you're heading to Pokhara, the most unique way to get there! Get briefed on river rafting and safety procedures by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge Glimpse scenic rock formations, bird flocks and a host of natural wonders as you brave the Trisuli River! Suitable for beginners to intermediates Travel by public or private transport with your guides from / to Kathmandu Or enhance your private transfer from Kathmandu to Pokhara by adding a rafting venture Get briefed on river rafting and safety procedures by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge Get briefed on river rafting and safety procedures by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge Glimpse scenic rock formations, bird flocks and a host of natural wonders as you brave the Trisuli River! Suitable for beginners to intermediates Suitable for beginners to intermediates Travel by public or private transport with your guides from / to Kathmandu Travel by public or private transport with your guides from / to Kathmandu Or enhance your private transfer from Kathmandu to Pokhara by adding a rafting venture Or enhance your private transfer from Kathmandu to Pokhara by adding a rafting venture What We Love:   What We Love: Get a taste for the famed river rafting spot in Nepal: the Trisuli River. With origins in the Himalayas, snaking through to the nation's southern plains, the river is rife with scenic gorges, rock formations and local villages, as well as flocks of native and migrant birds. Savor a rush of adrenaline as you paddle through foamy white water and feel the power of the rapids, fascinatingly named: Ladies' Delight, Monsoon, Upset and Surprise! Those trying out whitewater rafting for the first time need not worry, as the Trisuli offers the perfect rapids for beginner to intermediate participants. It's also the better way to get from Kathmandu to Pokhara – instead of taking a flight or drive, why not enjoy an exhilarating waterborne journey from one city to the other?

Get a taste of local cuisine set to a cultural dance performance Savor a delicious dinner meal of Nepali staples at a well-loved local restaurant Enjoy a Mayar Dance showcase as you dine Relish the sensory feast as you gain a better appreciation for local culture and tradition Savor a delicious dinner meal of Nepali staples at a well-loved local restaurant Savor a delicious dinner meal of Nepali staples at a well-loved local restaurant Enjoy a Mayar Dance showcase as you dine Enjoy a Mayar Dance showcase as you dine Relish the sensory feast as you gain a better appreciation for local culture and tradition Relish the sensory feast as you gain a better appreciation for local culture and tradition What We Love:   What We Love: Unwind after a day around Nepal's ancient cities with a cultural feast of dinner and dancing. This evening activity features a meal at one of three renowned local restaurants: Nepalli Chulo, Bhojan Griha or Utsav Restaurant, where you'll be served with an assortment of traditional Nepali dishes. Savor the strong and aromatic flavors of lamb curry, scoop up some dal bhat – a rice dish of lentils served with pickles, meat (or fish), and other sides – and finally get a taste of sel roti, the popular local snack. Mid-dinner, professional performers will showcase a special number featuring the Mayar (peacock) Dance, delivering you a wonderful nighttime feast in celebration of food and culture!

Bike downhill from the peak of Kakani, perched along a ridge 2,073m above sea level Bike from the top through Shivapuri Nagarjun National Park, home to the valley's forests and main water supply Take in captivating views of the Himalayas on your way down Pass through the mystical Budhanilkantha, home to the slumbering Vishnu sculpture Bike from the top through Shivapuri Nagarjun National Park, home to the valley's forests and main water supply Bike from the top through Shivapuri Nagarjun National Park, home to the valley's forests and main water supply Take in captivating views of the Himalayas on your way down Take in captivating views of the Himalayas on your way down Pass through the mystical Budhanilkantha, home to the slumbering Vishnu sculpture Pass through the mystical Budhanilkantha, home to the slumbering Vishnu sculpture What We Love:   What We Love: Ride downhill on mountain bike from the 2,732m-high ridge of Kakani. Wind through Shivapuri Nagarjun National Park, home to the valley's water supply and over 170 winged species and rare orchids. The forest is among the last of Kathmandu's woodlands. From there you'll visit Budhanilkantha, an area off tourist routes, reserved for devotees of Buddhism and Hinduism. See the reclining black stone statue of Vishnu, resting upon the coils of Ananta, the 11-headed snake god, who you might glimpse en route to Kathmandu city. It's a daylong journey that begins at the top, dispatching you into an exhilarating bike adventure from the countryside to the city.

Pass through local villages and make your way up to the legendary Namobuddha on bike Embark on the revered Buddhist Pilgrimage and see the Namobuddha – by mountain bike! Begin your journey from Dhulikhel, a Newari town blessed with incredible views of the Himalaya Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant on top of mountain Get to Panauti, a picturesque old city, en route back to Kathmandu Embark on the revered Buddhist Pilgrimage and see the Namobuddha – by mountain bike! Embark on the revered Buddhist Pilgrimage and see the Namobuddha – by mountain bike! Begin your journey from Dhulikhel, a Newari town blessed with incredible views of the Himalaya Begin your journey from Dhulikhel, a Newari town blessed with incredible views of the Himalaya Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant on top of mountain Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant on top of mountain Get to Panauti, a picturesque old city, en route back to Kathmandu Get to Panauti, a picturesque old city, en route back to Kathmandu What We Love:   What We Love: According to legend, there once was a prince named Mahasattya who offered himself to a starving tigress and her baby cubs. Today, the Namobuddha, situated at an altitude of approx. 2,500m, marks the commemorative site of this incredible tale – a remarkable story to keep in mind as you bike to the statue from Dhulikhel. Journey through paved roads, rough trails, and rice terraces. Once at the Namobuddha, take in the grandeur of the temple, stupa and shrines on-site. Typically a multi-day pilgrimage, this biking adventure takes you through the same local villages in a single day. You'll also be served lunch, before continuing on your journey to Panauti, and heading back to Kathmandu.

Drive to Nagarkot Hilltop, renowned for its incredible sunrise views Watch the sun rise from the perch of Nagarkot Hilltop Glimpse picturesque, snowcapped mountain peaks of eastern Nepal Take in incredible views of the Himalayan mountain range and see if you could spot Mt. Everest Watch the sun rise from the perch of Nagarkot Hilltop Watch the sun rise from the perch of Nagarkot Hilltop Glimpse picturesque, snowcapped mountain peaks of eastern Nepal Glimpse picturesque, snowcapped mountain peaks of eastern Nepal Take in incredible views of the Himalayan mountain range and see if you could spot Mt. Everest Take in incredible views of the Himalayan mountain range and see if you could spot Mt. Everest What We Love:   What We Love: See one of the most incredible sunrises from atop Nagarkot hill. Situated east of Kathmandu at over 2,000m above sea level, this spot is known best for its panoramic views of the rising sun. Begin your day in the dark and drive up to Nagarkot Hill Station, where you'll also see the rest of the Himalayan Range including, yes, Mt. Everest. Then wait as the early splinters of light cuts through the horizon – it's an experience for the books you're sure to treasure for a long, long time.

Abseil down rock formations and waterfalls 20m to 60m in height! Plunge into the cool waters of natural pools Plunge into the cool waters of natural pools Be guided by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge Be guided by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge What We Love:   What We Love: Embark on a thrilling mountain descent in the canyons of Kakani, just 30 minutes outside of Kathmandu city. Resting on a ridge some 2,073m above sea level, the village offers incredible sights of the Himalaya, from Annapurna to Everest. It's a breathtaking scenery to soak in as you scramble and abseil down rock faces, navigate between waterfalls and plunge into pools. Be guided by experienced canyoneers, who'll brief you prior to your adventure and take the lead in your expedition. You'll also be equipped with full safety instructions and gear, so leave you fears at the door and enjoy the downward climb!

Soak in Nepal's rich, ancient culture at two royal cities Explore ancient Patan and see why it's called the 'City of Living Art' Learn about the city's Buddhist and Hindu heritage from centuries-old museum artifacts See Bhaktapur Durbar Square in Nepal's 'City of Devotees', rife with religious sites and art Be taken back in time as you walk past one sky-high pagoda after another Marvel at the 30m-tall Nyatapola Temple, constantly ringing with bells and percussion Explore ancient Patan and see why it's called the 'City of Living Art' Explore ancient Patan and see why it's called the 'City of Living Art' Learn about the city's Buddhist and Hindu heritage from centuries-old museum artifacts Learn about the city's Buddhist and Hindu heritage from centuries-old museum artifacts See Bhaktapur Durbar Square in Nepal's 'City of Devotees', rife with religious sites and art See Bhaktapur Durbar Square in Nepal's 'City of Devotees', rife with religious sites and art Be taken back in time as you walk past one sky-high pagoda after another Be taken back in time as you walk past one sky-high pagoda after another Marvel at the 30m-tall Nyatapola Temple, constantly ringing with bells and percussion Marvel at the 30m-tall Nyatapola Temple, constantly ringing with bells and percussion What We Love:   What We Love: In Kathmandu Valley are three ancient cities, once independently ruled by their respective Malla kings: Kathmandu, Patan and Bhaktapur. In this day trip, visit Patan and Bhaktapur, home to cultural UNESCO World Heritage Sites that hark back to Nepal's rich past. You'll learn to appreciate Patan's name in Sanskrit, Lalitpur, which means ‘City of Living Art.' (Hint: it's home to the valley's finest sculptors and craftsmen.) Over in Bhaktapur, experience what it's like to wade slowly back in time, with streets and architecture retaining their olden, brickmade charm. All throughout, pay close attention to their shared religious heritage. Of Buddhist and Hindu backgrounds, both Patan and Bhaktapur are wealthy with temples, shrines, idols and sculptures in honor of their gods – giving you an endless count of sights over which to marvel.

Hike from Nagarkot to Changunarayan and take in spectacular views and structures Explore the hillside town of Nagarkot, home to spectacular Himalayan views Glimpse daily life for the Tamang and Newar ethnic groups as you walk through scenic pastures and fields Visit the Changu Narayan Temple, a World Heritage Site See the incredible stone, wood and metal carvings that date back to the Lichhavi period (4th-9th century) Explore the hillside town of Nagarkot, home to spectacular Himalayan views Explore the hillside town of Nagarkot, home to spectacular Himalayan views Glimpse daily life for the Tamang and Newar ethnic groups as you walk through scenic pastures and fields Glimpse daily life for the Tamang and Newar ethnic groups as you walk through scenic pastures and fields Visit the Changu Narayan Temple, a World Heritage Site Visit the Changu Narayan Temple, a World Heritage Site See the incredible stone, wood and metal carvings that date back to the Lichhavi period (4th-9th century) See the incredible stone, wood and metal carvings that date back to the Lichhavi period (4th-9th century) What We Love:   What We Love: Nepal is one of the best places in the world to go trekking, and this route is a great place to start for those unused to heavy hiking, preferring a leisurely walking journey. Take in the spectacular Himalayan range in the hillside town of Nagarkot, famed for its sunrise views, and glimpse the majestic Annapurna mountain range to the west and Everest to the east. From there, you'll be led to the Changunarayan Temple, a Vishnu shrine dating back to the 4th century. Made of elaborate carvings in stone, wood and metal, the oldest temple in Kathmandu is an incredible work of art to behold – so much so that it's one of seven World Heritage Sites in the country.

Spend a day getting to know Kathmandu Valley's ancient cities Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambhunath Stupa Explore Boudhanath Stupa, the largest stupa in Nepal and holiest Tibetan Buddhist Temple outside Tibet See open-air cremation sites at Pashupatinath, at Bagmati River (optional) Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambhunath Stupa Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambhunath Stupa Explore Boudhanath Stupa, the largest stupa in Nepal and holiest Tibetan Buddhist Temple outside Tibet Explore Boudhanath Stupa, the largest stupa in Nepal and holiest Tibetan Buddhist Temple outside Tibet See open-air cremation sites at Pashupatinath, at Bagmati River (optional) See open-air cremation sites at Pashupatinath, at Bagmati River (optional) What We Love:   What We Love: Spend a day exploring Kathmandu Valley's UNESCO-listed World Heritage Sites. Explore Durbar Square, the olden kingdom throne of Kathmandu's rulers, before visiting the most important Buddhist shrine in all of Nepal: Swayambhunath Stupa, also known as Monkey Temple. You'll also get to see Boudhanath, the largest stupa in Nepal and the holiest Tibetan Buddhist Temple outside Tibet. And for those who would like to delve deeper into local cultures, Pashupatinath is a not-to-be-missed as one of the most important Hindu Temples in Nepal, located near the Bagmati river. At the gates, plateaus are made that are used for the open air cremations that take place on a daily basis. You'll get better acquainted with the nation's rich heritage in this day trip, spanning the valley's ancient cities, as you wade through their numerous cultural and religious monuments.

Go back in time with a trip to two of the Himalayan country's old villages Meander amongst the residents of Bungamati as they go about their day-to-day activities See the Rato Machhendranath Temple, a Hindu temple for the patron god of Patan Visit the Newari village of Khokana and get to know the local farming community Learn about its renowned mustard oil and harvesting process See the 3-storey temple dedicated the local mother goddess, Shikali Mai Meander amongst the residents of Bungamati as they go about their day-to-day activities Meander amongst the residents of Bungamati as they go about their day-to-day activities See the Rato Machhendranath Temple, a Hindu temple for the patron god of Patan See the Rato Machhendranath Temple, a Hindu temple for the patron god of Patan Visit the Newari village of Khokana and get to know the local farming community Visit the Newari village of Khokana and get to know the local farming community Learn about its renowned mustard oil and harvesting process Learn about its renowned mustard oil and harvesting process See the 3-storey temple dedicated the local mother goddess, Shikali Mai See the 3-storey temple dedicated the local mother goddess, Shikali Mai What We Love:   What We Love: Venture into the ancient villages of Kathmandu Valley in this exploration of Bungamati and Khokana. Because of their relative inaccessibility, visiting the towns is akin to going back in time – a time when locals gather in main squares and the call of everyday work intermingles with communal life. Such are what you'll see on this journey, with Bungamati's resident woodcarvers and craftsfolk hard at work. The place is home to the shrine of Rato Macchendranath, patron god of Patan, alongside other religious monuments. You can expect a similar ambience in Khokana, where locals live largely off of their agriculture. Learn about their renowned produce, mustard oil, and the unique way it is harvested, then pay a visit to the landmark three-storey temple dedicated to Shikali Mai, the local mother goddess.

Breathe in Nepal's history and culture through a half-day trip to two heritage sites Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Take in the grandiose architecture of palaces, Hindu and Buddhist temples and shrines Learn about Nepal's political, religious and cultural heritage Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambunath Stupa To reach the temple, climb the 365-step staircase through a forest populated with monkeys Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Take in the grandiose architecture of palaces, Hindu and Buddhist temples and shrines Take in the grandiose architecture of palaces, Hindu and Buddhist temples and shrines Learn about Nepal's political, religious and cultural heritage Learn about Nepal's political, religious and cultural heritage Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambunath Stupa Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambunath Stupa To reach the temple, climb the 365-step staircase through a forest populated with monkeys To reach the temple, climb the 365-step staircase through a forest populated with monkeys What We Love:   What We Love: Uncover the wonders of Nepal in this day trip to two UNESCO-listed World Heritage Sites. Explore Durbar Square, once the kingdom throne of the capital's rulers, and take in the ancient beauty of its numerous temples, shrines and idols. You'll also visit the Swayambunath Stupa, known as the most important Buddhist shrine in all of Nepal. Nicknamed Monkey Temple, the Stupa is situated atop a hillside that can be reached through a monkey-populated forest. Spend half a day getting to know this mountainous country through its rich, ancient history, as you thread landmark sites of religious and cultural landscape.

Be briefed with safety instructions and procedures prior to takeoff Foot-launch and foot-land on a paraglider – it's like flying with your own wings! Take in airborne views of the Himalaya. See the Annapurnas, Mt. Everest, Mt. Fish Tail and more Learn the controls of paragliding from your partner pilot Get the experience of a lifetime with Avia Club Nepal, the city's top operator for the airborne adventure! Designed as tandem flights, you'll be paired with a pilot as you foot-launch from the 1,592m takeoff point in Sarangkot, and foot-land by the placid Phewa Lake. It's an experience akin to having your own wings! Replace any fear of heights with awe and wonder at scenic views of the Himalayas, with sights of the Annapurnas, Mt. Everest and the virgin Mt. Fish Tail, as well an incredible bird's eye glimpse of Pokhara Valley. You'll also get a crash course on paragliding controls as your pilot navigates the flight. So keep your eyes open, take a deep breath and make that leap into Pokhara skies – it's going to be a journey you'll never forget.

Quickly transit between Pokhara and Kathmandu City by plane Swiftly journey from Pokhara to Kathmandu City (OR Kathmandu City to Pokhara) with this 25-minute flight aboard Simrik Airlines, Buddha Air or Yeti Airlines (subject to scheduling availability) Enjoy comfortable hotel-airport and airport-hotel transfers in both cities Glimpse the natural Nepali landscape as you fly high up in the air Swiftly journey from Pokhara to Kathmandu City (OR Kathmandu City to Pokhara) with this 25-minute flight aboard Simrik Airlines, Buddha Air or Yeti Airlines (subject to scheduling availability) Swiftly journey from Pokhara to Kathmandu City (OR Kathmandu City to Pokhara) with this 25-minute flight aboard Simrik Airlines, Buddha Air or Yeti Airlines (subject to scheduling availability) Enjoy comfortable hotel-airport and airport-hotel transfers in both cities Enjoy comfortable hotel-airport and airport-hotel transfers in both cities Glimpse the natural Nepali landscape as you fly high up in the air Glimpse the natural Nepali landscape as you fly high up in the air What We Love:   What We Love: Fly from Pokhara to Kathmandu City (or vice versa) with ease via leading local airlines - Simrik Airlines, Buddha Air, Yeti Airlines – and add some much-deserved convenience to your trip. Those with tighter itineraries will appreciate the swift transit of these one-way flights. Bringing both cities within easy access of the other, hopping aboard a plane is a great way to optimize your Nepal stay!

Enjoy an exhilarating flight aboard an ultralight aircraft, provided by top local operators: Avia Club Nepal or Pokhara Ultralight (subject to scheduling availability) Enjoy an exhilarating flight aboard an ultralight aircraft, provided by top local operators: Avia Club Nepal or Pokhara Ultralight (subject to scheduling availability) Fly against scenic, mountainous views of the Himalayas Fly against scenic, mountainous views of the Himalayas Get a bird's eye view of the expansive Phewa Lake Get a bird's eye view of the expansive Phewa Lake Soar up to 9,000ft above sea level – and venture near the peak of Fish Tail Mountain! Soar up to 9,000ft above sea level – and venture near the peak of Fish Tail Mountain! What We Love:   What We Love: Afraid of heights? Leave your fear at the door once aboard an ultraflight aircraft and anticipate a thrilling adventure. Fly against the backdrop of the Himalayan Range, across lakes and plateaus and Nepal's expansive Phewa Lake. The journey, serviced by top local operators Avia Club Nepal and Pokhara Ultralight, will take you as high as 9,000ft above sea level, near the summit of Fish Tail Mountain and into Seti Valley. Keep your eyes open – there's no other way to taste the heights of Pokhara's mountainous beauty!

Experience the thrill of weightlessness for a whole 1.5 to 2 minutes over a 1.8km journey Rest assured in Highground Adventures' safety harnesses that meet world-accredited standards Shoot down an incline of 56 degrees – the steepest in the world for a zipline Shoot down an incline of 56 degrees – the steepest in the world for a zipline With a vertical drop of 2,000ft, it's also the world's tallest! Offered exclusively by Highground Adventures, the ZipFlyer takes you across incredible forest greenery with the captivating Mt. Machhapuchchhre (Fish Tail Mountain) in the background, as you accelerate to speeds of up to 120kph on your way down. Keep your eyes open, and savor the exhilarating thrill of a near free-fall on one of the world's most extreme ziplining experience!

Kayak down white rapids in this exhilarating river rafting adventure Enjoy 1.5hrs of non-stop paddling in the Upper Seti River Navigate through rapids that require 100% participation from all paddlers! Take in magnificent views of the Annapurna mountain range as you make your way down Rest assured in the safety of certified equipment, protective gear, and the guidance of experienced, professional kayakers Enjoy 1.5hrs of non-stop paddling in the Upper Seti River Enjoy 1.5hrs of non-stop paddling in the Upper Seti River Navigate through rapids that require 100% participation from all paddlers! Navigate through rapids that require 100% participation from all paddlers! Take in magnificent views of the Annapurna mountain range as you make your way down Take in magnificent views of the Annapurna mountain range as you make your way down Rest assured in the safety of certified equipment, protective gear, and the guidance of experienced, professional kayakers Rest assured in the safety of certified equipment, protective gear, and the guidance of experienced, professional kayakers What We Love:   What We Love: Savor the rush of adrenaline as you kayak down the Upper Seti in this rafting adventure. Just a quick ride from Lakeside Pokhara, it's an accessible thrill that offers no less a challenge than farther-flung options. Careen down white rapids Class IV and above, while looking up at backdrops of the marvelous, snow-capped Annapurna mountain range. Paddle and navigate clear Himalayan water, take in the beauty of suspension bridges and prayer flags, and enjoy a gripping ride down Pokhara's Seti River – with the city's top operators no less, Paddle Nepal and Royal Beach Nepal.

Share the skies with an Egyptian Vulture in this award-winning paragliding experience Soar through Pokhara skies with Kevin or Bob – rehabilitated Egyptian Vultures! Experience feeding the vulture as they land on your hand to take a bite Get a crash course on vulture conservation and how parahawking has helped prevent Nepal's vultures from extinction Contribute directly to vulture conservation projects in Nepal through your flight Capture photos and videos through the on-board camera Soar through Pokhara skies with Kevin or Bob – rehabilitated Egyptian Vultures! Soar through Pokhara skies with Kevin or Bob – rehabilitated Egyptian Vultures! Experience feeding the vulture as they land on your hand to take a bite Experience feeding the vulture as they land on your hand to take a bite Get a crash course on vulture conservation and how parahawking has helped prevent Nepal's vultures from extinction Get a crash course on vulture conservation and how parahawking has helped prevent Nepal's vultures from extinction Contribute directly to vulture conservation projects in Nepal through your flight Contribute directly to vulture conservation projects in Nepal through your flight Capture photos and videos through the on-board camera Capture photos and videos through the on-board camera What We Love:   What We Love: Share the skies with an Egyptian Vulture in this unique paragliding experience. Birds of prey are known to have a natural instinct to conserve energy as they fly, drawing toward thermals – rising currents of warm air – in order to travel farther distances without flapping their wings. With a trained vulture as your airborne guide, you'll soar against the Himalaya, across the dense forest green, and experience feeding the winged creature as it lands on your hand for a snack. You'll also be treated to a session on vulture conservation and learn how parahawking has helped prevent Nepal's vultures from extinction. Offered exclusively by Blue Sky Paragliding, it's an incredible initiative that brings together adventure, eco-tourism and conservation in an exhilarating journey, with proceeds going directly to conservation projects. Plus, where else in the world will you get to paraglide with vultures?

Drive the scenic route from Pokhara to Kathmandu City (or vice versa) Enjoy the convenience of a comfortable drive via air-conditioned car (2-3 pax), van (4-7 pax) or minibus (8-12 pax) Glimpse the natural Nepali landscape as you journey on the road See local villages and everyday life, as well as the captivating Himalayan mountainscape on the six- to seven-hour journey Enjoy the convenience of a comfortable drive via air-conditioned car (2-3 pax), van (4-7 pax) or minibus (8-12 pax) Enjoy the convenience of a comfortable drive via air-conditioned car (2-3 pax), van (4-7 pax) or minibus (8-12 pax) Glimpse the natural Nepali landscape as you journey on the road Glimpse the natural Nepali landscape as you journey on the road See local villages and everyday life, as well as the captivating Himalayan mountainscape on the six- to seven-hour journey See local villages and everyday life, as well as the captivating Himalayan mountainscape on the six- to seven-hour journey What We Love:   What We Love: Make it from Pokhara to Kathmandu City (or vice versa) with ease by private car, van or minibus and enjoy much-deserved convenience on your trip. A scenic drive across the Himalayan landscape is ideal for travelers not pressed for time, letting you better explore Nepali terrain while in transit. Needless to say, it's a great way to optimize your stay!

Pedal your way around the City of Lakes and see the best views the city has to offer Be guided up toward the Sarangkot ridge line, amidst spectacular views of the Annapurna mountain range Outside of the city, glimpse incredible views of Pokhara and Phewa Lake Ride past peaceful Nepali farmland en route to the lake shore and back to the city Savor a packed lunch during a short break in between Be guided up toward the Sarangkot ridge line, amidst spectacular views of the Annapurna mountain range Be guided up toward the Sarangkot ridge line, amidst spectacular views of the Annapurna mountain range Outside of the city, glimpse incredible views of Pokhara and Phewa Lake Outside of the city, glimpse incredible views of Pokhara and Phewa Lake Ride past peaceful Nepali farmland en route to the lake shore and back to the city Ride past peaceful Nepali farmland en route to the lake shore and back to the city Savor a packed lunch during a short break in between Savor a packed lunch during a short break in between What We Love:   What We Love: Pedal your way around Pokhara with this sightseeing-mountain biking adventure. Let the Nepali landscape take your breath away as you ride upward to the Sarangkot ridge line, and cycle amidst incredible views of the Annapurna mountain range. Bike past scenic sights of Pokhara City and Phewa Lake, then opt for a cross-country or single-track downhill route on the way down. You'll pass through quiet, picturesque Nepali farmland as you head to the lake shore, before making it back to the city before sundown. It's surely an exhilarating way to experience Nepal's second-largest city!

Experience a magnificent Pokhara sunrise Start early with breathtaking views of the sunrise atop Sarangkot Hill Glimpse spectacular panoramic views of the Himalayan range Go sightseeing around Sarangkot Hill Start early with breathtaking views of the sunrise atop Sarangkot Hill Start early with breathtaking views of the sunrise atop Sarangkot Hill Glimpse spectacular panoramic views of the Himalayan range Glimpse spectacular panoramic views of the Himalayan range Go sightseeing around Sarangkot Hill Go sightseeing around Sarangkot Hill What We Love:   What We Love: Picture light cutting through the horizon, reflecting a palette of colors upon the white-topped peaks of the world's highest mountains. Such is the sight atop Sarangkot Hill in this sunrise tour, in addition to spectacular surrounding views of the Himalayan range. Once the sun takes its place in the sky, you'll also get the chance to roam the hillside village. It's a rather beautiful start to the day, perfect for accommodating ensuing adventures in the city.

Spend a day exploring the best of Pokhara, the ‘City of Lakes' Visit the World Peace Pagoda and see the massive ivory Buddhist stupa Head to the gem-like Phewa Lake and enjoy an optional boat ride Make a stop at the Barahi Temple in the middle of the lake Drop by the Bindabasini Temple Visit the World Peace Pagoda and see the massive ivory Buddhist stupa Visit the World Peace Pagoda and see the massive ivory Buddhist stupa Head to the gem-like Phewa Lake and enjoy an optional boat ride Head to the gem-like Phewa Lake and enjoy an optional boat ride Make a stop at the Barahi Temple in the middle of the lake Make a stop at the Barahi Temple in the middle of the lake Drop by the Bindabasini Temple Drop by the Bindabasini Temple What We Love:   What We Love: Get to know Pokhara with this sightseeing adventure. Make a trip to the World Peace Pagoda, a beautiful white stupa built by Japanese Buddhists. Surrounding the area are beautiful views of the city, as well as sights of Phewa Lake nearby – where you'll head to next. Opt for a quiet boating trip on the water, before stopping by the Barahi Temple, located in the middle of the lake. Afterwards, drop by the Bindabasini Temple, an important Hindu site that's also one of the oldest temples in Nepal. With full- and half-day options, these easy sightseeing trips are welcome introductions to the rich city of Pokhara.

strIntroduction: Hop aboard a speedboat, swim with dolphins, and see Mauritius' breathtaking islands, including Ile aux Bénitiers Go on a two-hour swim with dolphins – in their very own turf! Snorkel the lively, underwater world of Mauritius' west coast Glimpse the beautiful rock gem in the middle of the ocean: Le Morne Crystal Rock Enjoy a savory barbecue lunch at the Island of Bénitiers Spend a lovely beach afternoon on Bénitiers – dip into clear, cool waters and take in breathtaking views of Le Morne Mountain Go on a two-hour swim with dolphins – in their very own turf! Go on a two-hour swim with dolphins – in their very own turf! Snorkel the lively, underwater world of Mauritius' west coast Snorkel the lively, underwater world of Mauritius' west coast Glimpse the beautiful rock gem in the middle of the ocean: Le Morne Crystal Rock Glimpse the beautiful rock gem in the middle of the ocean: Le Morne Crystal Rock Enjoy a savory barbecue lunch at the Island of Bénitiers Enjoy a savory barbecue lunch at the Island of Bénitiers Spend a lovely beach afternoon on Bénitiers – dip into clear, cool waters and take in breathtaking views of Le Morne Mountain Spend a lovely beach afternoon on Bénitiers – dip into clear, cool waters and take in breathtaking views of Le Morne Mountain What We Love:   What We Love: Hang out with aquamarine creatures and venture off into an island paradise in this day cruise. You'll be invited to dip into dolphin turf for some two hours, and swim with the friendly marine animals in the clear waters of Mauritius. There'll also be room for snorkeling, so keep your eyes open for the colorful world that awaits under water! From there it's back aboard a luxury speedboat, where you'll glimpse Le Morne Crystal Rock – a beautiful rock gem in the middle of the ocean – en route to Ile aux Bénitiers (Bénitiers Island), an island off the west coast. Indulge in a sumptuous barbecue lunch, and make the most of your stay by roaming the island before hopping back aboard, and sailing toward the afternoon's end.

Roam Mauritius with ease and convenience with a rented car or van for the day Enjoy your own personal ride for 8 consecutive hours a day in a car (for up to 4) or a van (for up to 13) Get picked up and dropped off around the island, from your hotel to various attractions and back With a personal driver on-hire to take you around, you also have the opportunity to get to know a local – and learn more about the people of Mauritius, too! With a personal driver on-hire to take you around, you also have the opportunity to get to know a local – and learn more about the people of Mauritius, too! What We Love:   What We Love: A small island in the Indian Ocean, Mauritius is relatively easy to traverse. For travelers, however, it is said that the best way to get around is to hail a taxi, or drive. Why not hire a car instead and spare yourself any peripheral trouble? With a driver of your own for a whole eight hours, you're set for the day's itinerary. Select from one of two rental rides: a car for parties of four, or a van for groups of up to 13, and you're ready for a memorable, trouble-free stay.

Swim amongst colorful fish with snorkel stops en route to La Preneuse Swim amongst colorful fish with snorkel stops en route to La Preneuse Enjoy a hearty lunch aboard the boat, featuring a bounty of fresh offerings Enjoy a hearty lunch aboard the boat, featuring a bounty of fresh offerings Glimpse scenic views of Rempart Mountain and Black River, as you head to the solitary Le Morne Crystal Rock Glimpse scenic views of Rempart Mountain and Black River, as you head to the solitary Le Morne Crystal Rock What We Love:   What We Love: Spend a beautiful day out on sea aboard the Harris Wilson, a 60ft ocean racer built for speedy travel. The luxury cruise begins with a sail out to Tamarin Bay, where you'll encounter dolphins and get the chance to join them in the water. Go for a hearty swim with these friendly creatures, before cruising further along to La Preneuse. With snorkeling stops all throughout, you'll get to experience more of Mauritius' underwater beauty, swimming amongst colorful fish and mesmerizing coral. The trip comes with a freshly prepared lunch on the catamaran, and a full boat crew to deliver no less than a memorable trip – capped off with a visit to Le Morne Crystal Rock, pristinely set in the middle of the ocean, and blessed with enthralling views of Rempart Mountain and Black River along the way.

Explore Mauritius' gems with a one- or three-hour ride on the Seakart Pilot your own Seakart, a version of the Jet Ski available only in Mauritius Ride past some of Mauritius' most spectacular waters and coastal sights: Benitier's Island lagoons, Le Morne peninsula, and Flic en Flac Enjoy welcome refreshments, breakfast and/or afternoon snacks with the Half-Day Ride Rest secure with full safety gear and security procedures Pilot your own Seakart, a version of the Jet Ski available only in Mauritius Pilot your own Seakart, a version of the Jet Ski available only in Mauritius Ride past some of Mauritius' most spectacular waters and coastal sights: Benitier's Island lagoons, Le Morne peninsula, and Flic en Flac Ride past some of Mauritius' most spectacular waters and coastal sights: Benitier's Island lagoons, Le Morne peninsula, and Flic en Flac Enjoy welcome refreshments, breakfast and/or afternoon snacks with the Half-Day Ride Enjoy welcome refreshments, breakfast and/or afternoon snacks with the Half-Day Ride Rest secure with full safety gear and security procedures Rest secure with full safety gear and security procedures What We Love:   What We Love: Experience the beauty of Mauritian waters on your very own speedboat – known as the Seakart, exclusive to the island. Think of it as riding your own Jet Ski, except with up to two people for company and the comfort of full, sit-back seating arrangements. Explore the sea foam-green lagoon of Benitier's Island, the emblematic Le Morne peninsula with its piercing mountaintop, and the tranquil seaside village of Flic en Flac. You'll get to ride in varying speeds as you cut through the water, and relish cool swimming breaks in between. It's the ultimate way to see one Mauritius landmark after another, while gracing both land and water of this oceanic gem.

Spend half a day at Mauritius' favorite nature & leisure park! Explore the park with an exciting quadbike ride Walk with lions and cheetahs – and stick around for a photo op or two! Meet and greet the park's zebras, deer, and giant tortoises on open grounds Explore the park with an exciting quadbike ride Explore the park with an exciting quadbike ride Walk with lions and cheetahs – and stick around for a photo op or two! Walk with lions and cheetahs – and stick around for a photo op or two! Meet and greet the park's zebras, deer, and giant tortoises on open grounds Meet and greet the park's zebras, deer, and giant tortoises on open grounds What We Love:   What We Love: At Mauritius' Casela Nature and Leisure Park, visitors are given wide-open freedom to enjoy the island's incredible natural gifts. In this day tour, get a taste of the park's best sights in a single, fuss-free journey. Enjoy an exciting quadbike ride across 14 hectares of greenery, greeting free-roaming wildlife: zebras, monkeys, peacocks, deer, and the incredible giant tortoises. A once-in-a-lifetime experience also awaits, where you'll get the chance to walk with lions and cheetahs – nowhere else in the world will you be able to snap intimate selfies with these wildcats!

Explore the southeast of Mauritius in this island getaway on speedboat Snorkel the lively and colorful seabed of Blue Bay Visit the historic Fouquets Island (Lighthouse Island) Head out to Grand River Southeast and take a mini boat ride to get closer to the waterfalls Enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch of lobster or giant prawns on the island paradise, Ile aux Cerfs Lounge and bask on the island for the rest of the afternoon Snorkel the lively and colorful seabed of Blue Bay Snorkel the lively and colorful seabed of Blue Bay Visit the historic Fouquets Island (Lighthouse Island) Visit the historic Fouquets Island (Lighthouse Island) Head out to Grand River Southeast and take a mini boat ride to get closer to the waterfalls Head out to Grand River Southeast and take a mini boat ride to get closer to the waterfalls Enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch of lobster or giant prawns on the island paradise, Ile aux Cerfs Enjoy a delicious barbecue lunch of lobster or giant prawns on the island paradise, Ile aux Cerfs Lounge and bask on the island for the rest of the afternoon Lounge and bask on the island for the rest of the afternoon What We Love:   What We Love: Embark on a fun-packed speedboat trip around the southeast of Mauritius, beginning with a snorkeling trip in the azure paradise of Blue Bay. Loved as a haven for watersports, you'll be captivated by the lively seabed that awaits, with coral life in full color amidst clear waters. From there, you're bound for the historic Fouquets Island (or Lighthouse Island), then to the Grand River Southeast, where you'll be treated to a mini boat trip bringing you closer to the waterfalls. Head then to Ile aux Cerfs, a white sand gem in the middle of the ocean, and enjoy a freshly prepared lunch of barbecue lobster or giant prawns – your choice, although you may indicate any dietary requirements if needed – before spending a day lounging on, and getting to know, the island itself.
strTitle: Speedboat to Blue Bay & Ile aux Cerfs

strIntroduction: Get to know Mauritius with a day at the capital and surrounding beaches! Enjoy sprawling views of Port Louis from Fort Adelaide – itself a national monument Get a taste for local shopping at the bustling Port Louis Bazaar and Caudan Waterfront Make a trip to the picturesque Cap Malheureux and see the beautiful, red-roofed Notre Dame church No Mauritius tour is complete without a stop at the beach – here, you'll get to visit the popular Grand Baie! Shop at the island's largest supermarket, Super U Enjoy sprawling views of Port Louis from Fort Adelaide – itself a national monument Enjoy sprawling views of Port Louis from Fort Adelaide – itself a national monument Get a taste for local shopping at the bustling Port Louis Bazaar and Caudan Waterfront Get a taste for local shopping at the bustling Port Louis Bazaar and Caudan Waterfront Make a trip to the picturesque Cap Malheureux and see the beautiful, red-roofed Notre Dame church Make a trip to the picturesque Cap Malheureux and see the beautiful, red-roofed Notre Dame church No Mauritius tour is complete without a stop at the beach – here, you'll get to visit the popular Grand Baie! No Mauritius tour is complete without a stop at the beach – here, you'll get to visit the popular Grand Baie! Shop at the island's largest supermarket, Super U Shop at the island's largest supermarket, Super U What We Love:   What We Love: Get to know this beautiful island with a sightseeing trip around Mauritius. Cover landmarks like Fort Adelaide, also known as La Citadelle, a national monument from where you could get sprawling views of the capital. Peruse local merchandise and get a taste for local shopping at the Central Market – also called Port Louis Bazaar – and the lively Caudan Waterfront, before heading north to Cap Malheureux, a fishing village punctuated by the photogenic, red-roofed Notre Dame Auxiliatrice. From here you'll be taken to Grand Baie Beach – the ‘Bay Without End' – and round off your trip at Super U, the largest supermarket on the island. If it sounds like a packed day, it sure is – one that leaves you a little more intimate with the island of paradise that is Mauritius!

Hop aboard a speedboat to Ile aux Cerfs and enjoy a host of watersports against stunning natural backdrop on this private tour Sail through the skies with a parasailing trip (accommodates 2) Cut through the water with a tube ride (accommodates 2) Roam the Mauritian seabed with an undersea walk Wander the fine, sandy beaches and splendid blue waters of Ile aux Cerfs Island See the roaring Grand River South East Waterfalls Indulge in a hearty lunch at the private island, Îlot Mangénie Sail through the skies with a parasailing trip (accommodates 2) Sail through the skies with a parasailing trip (accommodates 2) Cut through the water with a tube ride (accommodates 2) Cut through the water with a tube ride (accommodates 2) Roam the Mauritian seabed with an undersea walk Roam the Mauritian seabed with an undersea walk Wander the fine, sandy beaches and splendid blue waters of Ile aux Cerfs Island Wander the fine, sandy beaches and splendid blue waters of Ile aux Cerfs Island See the roaring Grand River South East Waterfalls See the roaring Grand River South East Waterfalls Indulge in a hearty lunch at the private island, Îlot Mangénie Indulge in a hearty lunch at the private island, Îlot Mangénie What We Love:   What We Love: Off the east coast of Mauritius is a strip of heaven on earth baptized ‘Ile aux Cerfs'. ‘Deer Island' in English and once home to Java-imported cerf, Ile aux Cerfs no longer hosts the creatures of the hunt, and instead offers locals and visitors some of the most stunning white beaches and turquoise waters. Spend a day at this island paradise and the ocean surrounding it with your own private tour, featuring exhilarating activities such as parasailing and tube riding. Roam the ocean bed with an undersea walk, snorkel around captivating lagoons, and then drop by the Grand River Waterfalls. Inclusive of a barbecue lunch on the neighboring private island, Îlot Mangénie, this package promises to deliver a full day of sun kissed memories, and genuine splashes of wonder.

Experience Mauritius' natural bounty, playful marine creatures and wildlife, located southwest of the island on this private tour Hop aboard a speedboat to Tamarin Bay and enjoy an exhilarating swim with dolphins! Enjoy a picture-perfect drive to Chamarel See Chamarel's waterfalls and the natural wonder that is the Seven Coloured Earth Spend the rest of your afternoon meeting and greeting wildlife at Casela Nature & Leisure Park Get the option to zipline, ride Segways or quadbikes, and even walk with lions! Hop aboard a speedboat to Tamarin Bay and enjoy an exhilarating swim with dolphins! Hop aboard a speedboat to Tamarin Bay and enjoy an exhilarating swim with dolphins! Enjoy a picture-perfect drive to Chamarel Enjoy a picture-perfect drive to Chamarel See Chamarel's waterfalls and the natural wonder that is the Seven Coloured Earth See Chamarel's waterfalls and the natural wonder that is the Seven Coloured Earth Spend the rest of your afternoon meeting and greeting wildlife at Casela Nature & Leisure Park Spend the rest of your afternoon meeting and greeting wildlife at Casela Nature & Leisure Park Get the option to zipline, ride Segways or quadbikes, and even walk with lions! Get the option to zipline, ride Segways or quadbikes, and even walk with lions! What We Love:   What We Love: Dip into the waters of Mauritius and get a taste for the island's breathtaking landscape in this full-day tour. Immerse yourself in the habitat of the island's marine residents, with a two-hour swim with Bottlenose and Spinner Dolphins off the coast of Tamarin Bay. Then take in scenic views of distant mountains and endless horizons en route to Chamarel, where you'll happen upon a waterfall and the renowned Seven Coloured Earth – a beautiful, natural phenomena of sand dunes with traces of red, violet, purple, blue, green, yellow and brown – the result of decomposed volcanic gullies, whose hues reveal the presence of different minerals. Afterwards it's off to Casela Nature & Leisure Park, where you'll meet and greet Mauritian wildlife and enjoy the option to zipline, roam on a quadbike and walk with lions!

Sail aboard a glass-bottom boat and snorkel the beautiful water world of Blue Bay Marine Park! Experience the wondrous blue waters of Blue Bay Marine Park, truly a gem of nature South East of Mauritius Hop aboard a glass-bottom boat for beautiful blue views of the ocean underneath Plunge into crystal clear waters for a swim, and snorkel the diverse marine world deep below See over 50 species of coral, and rub shoulders with Trumpet fish, Butterfly fish, Damselfish and countless more Experience the wondrous blue waters of Blue Bay Marine Park, truly a gem of nature South East of Mauritius Experience the wondrous blue waters of Blue Bay Marine Park, truly a gem of nature South East of Mauritius Hop aboard a glass-bottom boat for beautiful blue views of the ocean underneath Hop aboard a glass-bottom boat for beautiful blue views of the ocean underneath Plunge into crystal clear waters for a swim, and snorkel the diverse marine world deep below Plunge into crystal clear waters for a swim, and snorkel the diverse marine world deep below See over 50 species of coral, and rub shoulders with Trumpet fish, Butterfly fish, Damselfish and countless more See over 50 species of coral, and rub shoulders with Trumpet fish, Butterfly fish, Damselfish and countless more What We Love:   What We Love: Experience the turquoise waters of Mauritius' Blue Bay Marine Park in this boat and snorkeling trip. As though you couldn't get enough of the blue, you'll have the chance to sail aboard a glass-bottom boat, and be blessed with crystal clear views of the water underneath. Plus, while you can stay dry for the rest of the trip, we reckon it better to take the plunge – what's a vacation in Mauritius for? Swim through the beautiful turquoise gem, and venture deeper for a snorkel amongst colorful sea life, from mangroves to coral, and fish countless different kinds. With depths of up to 5.5m, a whole new world awaits your descent.

See volcanic craters and fiercely crashing waves, massive statues and factories in this private tour of the south See the dormant volcano Trou aux Cerfs, situated 600m or so in elevation Visit Historic Marine, the island's biggest ship model factory, and glimpse artisans in the meticulous process of reproducing ship models to scale Voyage to Grand Bassin, the massive crater lake revered by Gris Go on a glass-bottom boat trip and snorkeling trip at reef- and color-rich Blue Bay Go on a glass-bottom boat trip and snorkeling trip at reef- and color-rich Blue Bay What We Love:   What We Love: Well known for its golds and blues, the island paradise of Mauritius is also home to darker, earthier hues – as revealed in this tour of the south. See Trou aux Cerfs, a dormant volcano some 600m in elevation, before stopping at Historic Marine, the largest model ship factory in Mauritius. Then troop over to Grand Bassin, a crater lake that is also a sacred pilgrimage site for Hindus, and its surrounding shrines and temples – including the highest statue in Mauritius, the 33m-tall Shiva. A contrast from sibling emerald beaches, the southern tip of Gris Gris awaits next, with its fierce waves and charcoal cliffs, as well as the wave-chiseled Pont Naturel. The earthen palette lasts here, with a last stop at Blue Bay bringing back sights of turquoise waters and coral reefs, inviting many a visitor to a refreshing snorkel.

Roam the Grand Baie ocean bottom via a one-of-a-kind ride: the Subscooter! Taste the thrill of piloting your own Subscooter - on your own, or with a seatmate! - in 30m-deep, blue Mauritian waters Breathe freely inside the capsule, and enjoy panoramic views as you coast along Be led by an underwater guide who'll give you a half-hour tour of the mesmerizing ocean bed! See bountiful coral, busy schools of fish and witness the diversity of marine life in this underwater adventure Get a 15mins crash course on how to operate the Subscooter, and rest secure in full safety equipment and procedures Taste the thrill of piloting your own Subscooter - on your own, or with a seatmate! - in 30m-deep, blue Mauritian waters Taste the thrill of piloting your own Subscooter - on your own, or with a seatmate! - in 30m-deep, blue Mauritian waters Breathe freely inside the capsule, and enjoy panoramic views as you coast along Breathe freely inside the capsule, and enjoy panoramic views as you coast along Be led by an underwater guide who'll give you a half-hour tour of the mesmerizing ocean bed! Be led by an underwater guide who'll give you a half-hour tour of the mesmerizing ocean bed! See bountiful coral, busy schools of fish and witness the diversity of marine life in this underwater adventure See bountiful coral, busy schools of fish and witness the diversity of marine life in this underwater adventure Get a 15mins crash course on how to operate the Subscooter, and rest secure in full safety equipment and procedures Get a 15mins crash course on how to operate the Subscooter, and rest secure in full safety equipment and procedures What We Love:   What We Love: Diving and snorkeling are wonderful, but if you're game for another type of excursion along the seabed, then you'll love what's in store for you with the Subscooter. Easy to control and quick to get the hang of, the Subscooter is part-underwater taxi, part-submarine, making for an out-of-the-box ride around the Grand Bay seabed! Receive a quick, 15-minute orientation before getting into your wetsuit and piloting your own ‘vehicle.' Then, it's an approx. 30-meter descent to the bottom of the sea – which you'll spend a whole half-hour exploring! Breathe freely as you make your way around the sandy ocean bottom, following the lead of your underwater guide, and glimpse spectacular views of ocean life through the capsule's panoramic glass.

Experience the perfect Mauritian holiday with this luxury sailing and snorkeling trip Sail in luxury aboard a spacious, full-serviced 42ft. catamaran, complete with free-flowing drinks Board a speedboat to get up close to the Grand River Southeast Waterfalls Enjoy an afternoon of snorkeling in emerald blue waters, alongside scores of fish and coral life Indulge in a barbecue buffet lunch, featuring fresh produce: fish, chicken, salads and fruits, as well as dessert Bask on the paradise beach of Ile aux Cerfs island Sail in luxury aboard a spacious, full-serviced 42ft. catamaran, complete with free-flowing drinks Sail in luxury aboard a spacious, full-serviced 42ft. catamaran, complete with free-flowing drinks Board a speedboat to get up close to the Grand River Southeast Waterfalls Board a speedboat to get up close to the Grand River Southeast Waterfalls Enjoy an afternoon of snorkeling in emerald blue waters, alongside scores of fish and coral life Enjoy an afternoon of snorkeling in emerald blue waters, alongside scores of fish and coral life Indulge in a barbecue buffet lunch, featuring fresh produce: fish, chicken, salads and fruits, as well as dessert Indulge in a barbecue buffet lunch, featuring fresh produce: fish, chicken, salads and fruits, as well as dessert Bask on the paradise beach of Ile aux Cerfs island Bask on the paradise beach of Ile aux Cerfs island What We Love:   What We Love: Wander to the beautiful Ile aux Cerfs (Deer Island) in this day cruise aboard a 42ft. luxury catamaran. See the beauty of Mauritius as you sail across crystal blue water, amidst breathtaking landscapes, while jovial crew ensure you a well-serviced trip. You'll sail to the Grand River Southeast, where a speedboat will take you up close to the waterfalls, before snorkeling in the company of colorful coral and fish, residents of emerald lagoons. A full barbecue lunch buffet then awaits, filling you with generous servings of fresh fish and chicken, salads and fruits, readying you for the journey toward Ile aux Cerfs island. It's a sun kissed paradise of white sand beaches and inviting palm trees – the perfect last leg, in what we reckon is the best way to spend a day in Mauritius.

Go for a swim and snorkel through the pristine blue waters of Gabriel Island and the neighboring Flat Island Head northward of Mauritius towards Ilot Gabriel (Gabriel Island) and Ilot Plate (Flat Island), two immaculate slices of paradise set in the middle of the water Go swimming and snorkeling in crystal blue waters, and get up close to the lively marine life Indulge in a delicious barbecue lunch aboard the catamaran Head northward of Mauritius towards Ilot Gabriel (Gabriel Island) and Ilot Plate (Flat Island), two immaculate slices of paradise set in the middle of the water Head northward of Mauritius towards Ilot Gabriel (Gabriel Island) and Ilot Plate (Flat Island), two immaculate slices of paradise set in the middle of the water Go swimming and snorkeling in crystal blue waters, and get up close to the lively marine life Go swimming and snorkeling in crystal blue waters, and get up close to the lively marine life Indulge in a delicious barbecue lunch aboard the catamaran Indulge in a delicious barbecue lunch aboard the catamaran What We Love:   What We Love: Venture toward the extreme north of Mauritius on a catamaran, toward Ilot Gabriel – also known as Gabriel Island. It's a beautiful, protected natural reserve rich with untouched beaches – a marvel to behold and enjoy with family, or a loved one. You'll also get to visit the nearby Ilot Plate, or Flat Island, an impeccably pristine slice of land in the middle of the water. From snorkel dips between trips and wandering among colorful marine life, to swimming in dazzling emerald waters and taking in the picturesque horizons from your luxury boat, you're guaranteed, no doubt, one of the most laidback and leisurely journeys you'll ever make on the island.

Get to the bottom of the ocean without ever getting wet – in this submarine ride! Enjoy privacy and exclusivity in the water with your very own submarine Experience the depths of the Indian Ocean with this unique, underwater capsule ride Watch through distortion-free glass as fish and other marine creatures wade slowly past See what remains of an old shipwreck Learn more about the ocean with the knowledge and expertise of your submarine pilot Enjoy privacy and exclusivity in the water with your very own submarine Enjoy privacy and exclusivity in the water with your very own submarine Experience the depths of the Indian Ocean with this unique, underwater capsule ride Experience the depths of the Indian Ocean with this unique, underwater capsule ride Watch through distortion-free glass as fish and other marine creatures wade slowly past Watch through distortion-free glass as fish and other marine creatures wade slowly past See what remains of an old shipwreck See what remains of an old shipwreck Learn more about the ocean with the knowledge and expertise of your submarine pilot Learn more about the ocean with the knowledge and expertise of your submarine pilot What We Love:   What We Love: Often the stuff of movies, a submarine ride is now readily accessible with a click – and in the waters of Mauritius, no less. Explore the clear blue waters of the Indian Ocean in these underwater capsules, perfect for an extraordinary experience of the world under the sea. Glimpse colorful fish and other marine creatures through your distortion-free glass as they glide slowly past, and see the intriguing remnants of an old shipwreck. It's an experience for both the young and young-at-heart – and not to mention, one that can be shared by friends and families in a single ride! Get full privacy and exclusivity under the water with your very own submarine, in this magical – and dry! – journey in the ocean.

Take the leap of a lifetime by skydiving in Mauritius Plunge into azure skies and free fall above crystal blue waters – only in Mauritius! Keep your peace of mind with full safety gear and the operator's regular maintenance checks Rest secure with experienced tandem instructors who've each clocked in over 2,000 jumps Plunge into azure skies and free fall above crystal blue waters – only in Mauritius! Plunge into azure skies and free fall above crystal blue waters – only in Mauritius! Keep your peace of mind with full safety gear and the operator's regular maintenance checks Keep your peace of mind with full safety gear and the operator's regular maintenance checks Rest secure with experienced tandem instructors who've each clocked in over 2,000 jumps Rest secure with experienced tandem instructors who've each clocked in over 2,000 jumps What We Love:   What We Love: Everyone calls it Once In A Lifetime; we think it's so much more than that. Where else can you plunge into open skies with views of paradise down below? Enjoy an incredible skydiving experience in Mauritius with this tandem jump that's safe, secure, and spectacularly thrilling! Get briefed on safety instructions and suited up in full gear before taking flight and making the leap. You'll surely want video documentation of this.

Enjoy a laid back ride on a former racehorse around the coast of Le Morne or up to the beautiful mountains Saddle up and explore the beaches and mountains of Le Morne on a beautiful retired racehorse Take in the majesty of Le Morne Mountain, once home to slaves on the run for their freedom Wade into the water with your horse – don't worry, it's perfectly safe! Beach horseback riding is fairly easy, so participants are not required to have any riding experience however mountain horseback riding is relatively difficult so you must have previous riding experience or be ready to take on the challenge!
