Beach horseback riding is fairly easy, so participants are not required to have any riding experience however mountain horseback riding is relatively difficult so you must have previous riding experience or be ready to take on the challenge! What We Love:   What We Love: Tread the landmark Morne Brabant mountain on horseback and grace the monolithic peaks with renewed appreciation. Known as the refuge to runaway slaves in the 18th to early 19th centuries, Le Morne remains a powerful symbol of slave rights and freedom, suffering and sacrifice. Coupled with majestic sea views all around, including Benitier's Island to the north and Forneau Island to the south, you're sure to find yourself breathless with awe. You'll also get to dip in the cool waters of the beaches with your own mare, a beautiful, retired racehorse.

Explore the deep blue waters of Trou aux Biches with a diving course for beginners or a certified divers experience Venture deep into the clear azure waters of the Indian Ocean Learn to scuba dive with this introductory course and experience, tailored for beginners Swim alongside fish and various other sea creatures, as well as beautiful coral reef Take comfort in top notch scuba diving gear and equipment, as well as full safety operations assured by the operator Venture deep into the clear azure waters of the Indian Ocean Venture deep into the clear azure waters of the Indian Ocean Learn to scuba dive with this introductory course and experience, tailored for beginners Learn to scuba dive with this introductory course and experience, tailored for beginners Swim alongside fish and various other sea creatures, as well as beautiful coral reef Swim alongside fish and various other sea creatures, as well as beautiful coral reef Take comfort in top notch scuba diving gear and equipment, as well as full safety operations assured by the operator Take comfort in top notch scuba diving gear and equipment, as well as full safety operations assured by the operator What We Love:   What We Love: Make your way to the laidback beaches of Trou aux Biches, where you'll venture out on a boat before plunging into the waters for a dive. From here, it's an exploration of wonders under the sea, from coral full of color, to fish and other sea creatures full of life. Non-divers need not worry, as the scuba dives are tailored for both beginners and PADI-certified swimmers, inclusive of necessary lectures and orientations, as well as full gear and safety equipment. With the dive taking you farther to discover the ocean gems of Mauritius, the experience is sure to etch itself equally deeply in your memory.
strTitle: Trou aux Biches Scuba Diving Adventure

The boat is also fully furnished with a toilet and shower Be surrounded by generous views of Mauritius' breathtaking mountains and seascapes Enjoy full privacy with a 40ft boat rented out exclusively for your group – and the full service of experienced boat crew and anglers Enjoy full privacy with a 40ft boat rented out exclusively for your group – and the full service of experienced boat crew and anglers Be guided by experts, or demonstrate your own angling skills to score a catch in the rich waters of Mauritius Be guided by experts, or demonstrate your own angling skills to score a catch in the rich waters of Mauritius Ready yourself for a catch from the deep – the west coast seabed drops past 3,000m, making it home to a diversity of ocean species Ready yourself for a catch from the deep – the west coast seabed drops past 3,000m, making it home to a diversity of ocean species Replenish with complementary snacks and drinks onboard. The boat is also fully furnished with a toilet and shower Be surrounded by generous views of Mauritius' breathtaking mountains and seascapes Be surrounded by generous views of Mauritius' breathtaking mountains and seascapes What We Love:   What We Love: Hop aboard a fishing boat for a full day of adventure (half-day option also available). Known as a local favorite pastime – and for its record-breaking game! – big game fishing or deep sea fishing in Mauritius is an esteemed activity, drawing fishermen and enthusiasts of the sport from around the world. Try a hand at angling for the chance to score the revered blue marlin, a massive creature known to fight against being drawn up from the water! Or sink a hook for a black marlin instead, a tuna, or a mako shark. With an experienced crew on board to make every leg of the fishing trip worthwhile, you're bound for a uniquely Mauritian afternoon!

Go on an underwater adventure – on foot! Enjoy a guided tour of the sandy lagoon bottom of Grand Baie – a journey made entirely on foot, with a solar-powered breathing helmet! What We Love:   What We Love: A paraw is a small traditional boat with two outriggers sailed in the Philippines. Many believe paraw sailing to be an essential activity to put on their "things to do in Boracay" list. Why? The boat itself is worthy of admiration. A single shallow hull, made of wood and bamboo and adorned by a large sail, it needs two floaters or logs on each side to keep the balance. This sailing adventure is a rich cultural experience and loads of fun. Discover the beautiful Boracay island as you glide on crystal-clear turquoise waters with a fresh sea breeze. A paraw can accommodate 4 to 6 people, so bring some friends along to share your Boracay adventure!

strIntroduction: Walk the streets of Burma's ancient capital - the beautiful city of Bago - and discover a rich cultural, religious and historical heritage Explore Bago, the ancient capital of Burma, known today as Myanmar, on a private tour Learn about the city's rich cultural and historical background from your English speaking guide Catch a stunning view of Bago city from the hill of Hintha Gon Paya Pagoda Pay a visit to the luxurious Kanbawzathadi Palace and wonder through its 76 apartments and halls Explore Bago, the ancient capital of Burma, known today as Myanmar, on a private tour Learn about the city's rich cultural and historical background from your English speaking guide Catch a stunning view of Bago city from the hill of Hintha Gon Paya Pagoda Pay a visit to the luxurious Kanbawzathadi Palace and wonder through its 76 apartments and halls What We Love:   What We Love: Bago (or Pegu) is the ancient capital of Burma known today as Myanmar. Just 80 kilometers to the northeast of Yangon, this beautiful city is settled right by the Bago River. The town is bathed in legends. According to one of them, Buddha himself had predicted that a Buddhist country would prosper in the place where Bago now stands. Your eleven hour tour of Bago will be rich in culture and history with your English speaking guide always ready to answer questions. Visit the stunning pagodas: Hinthargone, Mya Tha Lyaung, Kyaik Pun and more. Visit the extravagant Kanbawzathadi Palace, consisting of 76 apartments and halls and explore the city's royal past.

Burma (Myanmar) has a truly fascinating history, tradition, and culture, and this Yangon city tour will give you the opportunity to explore some of the city’s icons and better understand local life here. Meet up with your English speaking guide and head to Chaukhtetkyi Pagoda, home to a reclining Buddha that's one of the most honoured in the country and one of the largest in all of Myanmar. After the visit to the Pagoda, your cultural tour of Yangon will continue with a walk through the local residential area, through Kandawgyi Park. Along the way, your guide will share local stories and anecdotes, as well as answer the many questions you likely have about local life in the city. We'll pause for a tea break and people watching before heading into the Shwedagon Pagoda, the real highlight of the tour. Its magnificent gold dome rises for a staggering 98 meters and is decorated with precious stones.

strIntroduction: Explore Thanlyin, a city rich in culture, history and Buddhist traditions and just a few hours away from Yangon Visit the quiet and peaceful town of Thanlyin, once a major port and trade center Marvel at the beauty of Kyaik Khauk Pagoda and learn about its rich history and traditions Spend some time in the small Buddhist town of Kyauktan and learn about Buddhist culture from your guide Take a boat ride to see the stunning Yele Paya Pagoda, towering on a small island in the middle of the river Visit the quiet and peaceful town of Thanlyin, once a major port and trade center Marvel at the beauty of Kyaik Khauk Pagoda and learn about its rich history and traditions Spend some time in the small Buddhist town of Kyauktan and learn about Buddhist culture from your guide Take a boat ride to see the stunning Yele Paya Pagoda, towering on a small island in the middle of the river What We Love:   What We Love: Thanlyin is the earliest establishment in Myanmar by Portuguese mercenary Filipe de Brito and was once an important Port City of the Mon Dynasty that held the title of Myanmar's main trading center from the 14th to the 17th century. The suburban town is now a peaceful sleeping village just two bridges across from Yangon. And you will get a chance to explore it in full on an 8 hour tour together with an English speaking guide. Start off with a visit to Kyaik Khauk Pagoda, a Buddhist Stupa and a popular pilgrimage sight. After the cultural part, have a break over lunch before enjoying a drive to Kyauktan, a Buddhist town to the south of Yangon. There, hop on a boat to visit the famous YelePhaya Pagoda set on a small island in the river.

strIntroduction: Rich pine forests, mountain lakes and some of the Himalaya's most photogenic peaks await you on this trek A wonderful trek to introduce you to the extensive Himalayas from Paro Valley Stunning views of the Himalayas along the way, easy climbs and relaxing descents Relaxing walks through blue pine forests and campsites by shimmering mountain likes Meditate to the view of Mount Gangkar Puensum, the highest mountain in Bhutan Visa, airport pick up, accommodation, transportation and food for the duration of the trek are all provided A wonderful trek to introduce you to the extensive Himalayas from Paro Valley Stunning views of the Himalayas along the way, easy climbs and relaxing descents Relaxing walks through blue pine forests and campsites by shimmering mountain likes Meditate to the view of Mount Gangkar Puensum, the highest mountain in Bhutan Visa, airport pick up, accommodation, transportation and food for the duration of the trek are all provided What We Love:   What We Love: The Druk Path Trek is the perfect introduction to the Himalayas — not too strenuous and yet boasting some of the most beautiful views of the Himalayas. This is why the Druk Path Trek is the most popular trek in Bhutan. Passing through a gorgeous natural landscape, it invites you to explore the country's rich forests of blue pines, firs and rhododendron trees. With campsites beneficially located close to stunning high altitude lakes, you get a chance to relax in a truly pristine environment and even try out your fishing skills. The trek also offers amazing views of Mount Gangkar Puensum, the highest mountain in Bhutan and the world's tallest unscaled peak

Over the next several days, you will get to visit and explore the beautiful Thimphu, Wangdue and Punakha valleys, hike through paddy fields and rice fields to fortresses and religious monuments, shop at farmers' markets and bazars, learn countless facts and listen to an abundance of legends surrounding Bhutan. On this immersive tour, you will get nine whole days to explore and understand Bhutan and see its main attractions. Start with exploring the kingdom's capital city – Thimphu. Go on to see Wangdue and Punkha valleys, challenge yourself with a 2 hour Gangtey Nature Hike, visit neighboring villages and dine at local farmhouses. Hunt for souvenirs in handicraft shops and learn about the kingdom from your English speaking guide. This is a recommended itinerary, however if you would like to adapt or create your own 9 days and 8 nights route, please do email us.

As you venture further into wilderness past shimmering lakes and pristine valleys, you will be treated to incredible views of the entire Himalayan mountain range. You will walk by Bhutanese villages and explore the age-old traditions and customs of the region. A visit to Talakha Monastery is sure to let the area's peacefulness wash over you as you wake up to the sounds of early morning prayers in the total tranquility of forest covered mountain ranges.

Get the full experience of Bhutan's unique landscape up close on a trek in the heart of the Himalayas with camping at beautiful Jangothang Traverse rich pine forests, flowery meadows and snow-capped peaks Experience fabulous views of Mt. Jomolhari and Mt. Jomolhari and Mt. Jichu Drake Camp at one of Bhutan's most beautiful sites — Jangothang Pass by the beautiful villages of Soe, Takethang Thangthangkha and Dangochang Lingzhi and trek down the Paro Chhu River Visa, airport pick up, accommodation, transportation and food for the duration of the trek are all provided What We Love:   What We Love: The beautiful Jomolhari trek highlights the amazing diversity Bhutan's landscape has to offer. Passing through thick pine forests, quaint local villages and flower-filled Himalayan meadows, you will get to dive into the nature and culture of Bhutan. Stop by Jangothang, one of the most beautiful campsites of the Himalayas and enjoy the fabulous views of snow-capped mountains such as Mt. Jomolhari and Mt. Jichu Drake. The trek requires a short period of acclimatization and a relatively strong fitness condition, as you will be attaining altitudes of 4,080m. It's not for the fainthearted but the nature and views you experience will be well worth the effort!

Hidden away from the rest of the world amidst high mountains, Bhutan has managed to preserve its special culture and heritage sites in an almost pristine condition. During the 7 day tour, you will get to see the best of them, from ancient temples, museums and fortresses to natural mountain valleys, farmhouses and bustling markets. Your tour concludes with the ultimately relaxing hot stone bath and a delicious traditional dinner with a local family. This is a recommended itinerary, however if you would like to adapt or create your own 7 days and 6 nights route, please do email us.

Leave the busy world behind for three days of mountain trekking through stunning Bhutan countryside for panoramic views of the snow capped Himalayas Walk through colorful meadows and trek virgin forests rich in exotic flora and fauna Enjoy an exciting picnic at 3,280m as your gaze drifts over mountain tops and valleys Learn about local flowers, plants and trees and keep an eye out for the evasive wildlife from musk deer to blood pheasants Reach the highest point of the trek at 4,000m before descending down to Chelela Pass Walk through colorful meadows and trek virgin forests rich in exotic flora and fauna Enjoy an exciting picnic at 3,280m as your gaze drifts over mountain tops and valleys Learn about local flowers, plants and trees and keep an eye out for the evasive wildlife from musk deer to blood pheasants Reach the highest point of the trek at 4,000m before descending down to Chelela Pass What We Love:   What We Love: Take in breathtaking mountain views as you trek from Sagala to Paro in the picturesque Bhutan. Start your journey with a relaxing walk through blue pine and fir forests and let the winding trails take you to Khadey Gom at 3,280m for a delicious picnic. Look out onto the mountain peaks and valleys laid out below and keep your eyes sharp for a chance to spot a musk deer. Day two will take you across flower-filled meadows to the beautiful Nyingungla camp at 3,874m, where you can explore exotic plants and trees and stay on the lookout for more animal sightings. Your final hike on day three takes you to the highest point of the trip — Gung Karpo ridge at 4,000m, from where unfolds a stunning view of snow-clad mountain tops and colorful plains.

Let the amazing natural countryside, stunning mountain views and lush flora tell you the story of Bhutan on a three/four day, 22 kilometer trekking expedition Trek the pristine natural valleys and forests of Bhutan on the Bumthang Owl Trek Visit local villages and Buddhist monasteries, exploring ancient culture and customs Catch a glimpse of the world's highest unclimbed peak - Mt. Gangkar Puensum Explore abundant local vegetation: blue pines, hemlock, fir, spruce and more Tours are led by an experienced expedition leader with helpers, horses, tents, sleeping bags, medical kit and permits all included Visa, airport pick up, accommodation, transportation and food for the duration of the trek are all provided Trek the pristine natural valleys and forests of Bhutan on the Bumthang Owl Trek Visit local villages and Buddhist monasteries, exploring ancient culture and customs Catch a glimpse of the world's highest unclimbed peak - Mt. Walk along tranquil trails passing thick forests, rich in rare blue pine, majestic maple and strong bamboo. Visit ancient Buddhist temples and monasteries and marvel at the unobstructed view of Mt. Gangkar Puensum - the highest unconquered peak in the world. Catch a glimpse of the rare Himalayan Tragopan, a brightly plumed pheasant, typically spotted from April to May and complete the journey by trekking the scenic Royal Heritage Trail on the third day of the tour to round off a challenging but rewarding and beautiful trek. Expeditions are led by an experienced guide and accompanied by a team of professionals, including horses to carry all personal gear. Meals along the trail are provided and well as sleeping bags and mats, so all you really need to think about is committing the spectacular views to memory (or camera memory card!)

One of the most challenging and notably beautiful treks in Bhutan, the Laya to Gasa trek is a unique high altitude experience Enjoy postcard views of alpine valleys, lush forests and signature Bhutan mountain peaks Visit numerous local settlements to learn about the life of local Laya people engaged in intricate arts and crafts Keep your eyes sharp for a chance to spot blue sheep, marmots, must deer and Takin, the national animal of Bhutan Camp beneath some of Bhutan's most picturesque peaks, Mount Jomolhari and Mount Jichu Drake Visa, airport pick up, accommodation, transportation and food for the duration of the trek are all provided Enjoy postcard views of alpine valleys, lush forests and signature Bhutan mountain peaks Visit numerous local settlements to learn about the life of local Laya people engaged in intricate arts and crafts Keep your eyes sharp for a chance to spot blue sheep, marmots, must deer and Takin, the national animal of Bhutan Camp beneath some of Bhutan's most picturesque peaks, Mount Jomolhari and Mount Jichu Drake Visa, airport pick up, accommodation, transportation and food for the duration of the trek are all provided What We Love:   What We Love: Considered one of the most scenic treks in Bhutan, the Laya-Gasa trek offers amazing views of Bhutan's diverse unspoiled landscape: lush forests, high mountain peaks and green valleys. The 217km journey begins in Paro and takes you through evergreen jungles, challenging mountain passes and flowery meadows before finalizing in Damji. You will get to visit the Jigme Singye National Park, catch glimpses of the stunning mountain peaks: Mt. Jomolhari, Jichu Drake and Tsherimgang and walk along a charming village with a crystal clear waterfall. A big highlight of the journey is the chance to explore the life of indigenous villages inhabited by Laya people and discover their unique culture and traditions.

On your second day, pay a visit to - Takin Preserve, housing the rare animals only found in this area. Takins are members of the goat family residing in very high altitudes and are the national animals of Bhutan. Day three lets you discover Dochla Pass and Paro Valley with stopovers at a traditional farmhouse and a hot stone bath to complete the day. Your fourth day in Bhutan will challenge you with a hike up to Tiger's Nest and inspire with a visit to Kyichu Lhakhang, a Himalayan Buddhist temple. This is a recommended itinerary however, if you would like to adapt or create your own 5 days and 4 nights route, please do email us.

Your tour starts at Beijing's world renowned Capital Museum, one of the best places to acquaint yourself with the history and culture of this capital city. The museum is divided into two halls, each with six floors of exhibits and here you can learn more about ancient Beijing through its hundreds of years of folk custom and culture. After lunch at a local restaurant, you'll visit the magnificent gardens at the Prince Gong's Mansion, Beijing's largest and best-preserved royal mansion from the days of the Qing Dynasty. Next up is a hutong rickshaw ride to tour the streets of old Beijing. This portion of the tour allows you to get a taste of life in the city as your driver pedals through Beijing's old and narrow streets. It includes a stop to visit the home of a Chinese family and a trip up to the top of an old drum tower for a bird's eye view of the area. Overall, a great introduction to old Beijing!

The majority of the wall which exists today was built by the Ming Dynasty to keep out invaders from the north. With its steep winding exterior, the Great Wall is perhaps one of the world's most iconic tourist attractions, and certainly one of the China's most captivating sights. This 1 day adventure will not only take you to see the amazing Great Wall at Badaling, the section visited by the likes of Richard Nixon, Barack Obama, and Margaret Thatcher no less, you'll also be shown around Beijing's Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square – the largest public square in the world. Opened to the public back in 1986, this part of the wall is located 80 kilometers north-east of Beijing. Due to its more remote located, this part of the wall is far less visited, so you won't be fighting for space with other tourists.
